1.name: Bride of Frankenstein
1.description: Mary Shelley reveals the main characters of her novel survived: Dr. Frankenstein, goaded by an even madder scientist, builds his monster a mate.

2.name: The 39 Steps
2.description: A man in London tries to help a counter-espionage Agent. But when the Agent is killed, and the man stands accused, he must go on the run to save himself and stop a spy ring which is trying to steal top secret information.

3.name: Mutiny on the Bounty
3.description: A tyrannical ship captain decides to exact revenge on his abused crew after they form a mutiny against him, but the sailor he targets had no hand in it.

4.name: Alice Adams
4.description: The misadventures of two social-climbing women in small town America.

5.name: A Night at the Opera
5.description: A sly business manager and two wacky friends of two opera singers help them achieve success while humiliating their stuffy and snobbish enemies.

6.name: Top Hat
6.description: An American dancer comes to Britain and falls for a model whom he initially annoyed, but she mistakes him for his goofy producer.

7.name: Roberta
7.description: In Paris, a man clueless about fashion suddenly inherits his aunt's dress shop, while his bandleader friend reunites with his old flame.

8.name: Captain Blood
8.description: After being wrongly convicted as a traitor, Peter Blood, an English physician, is sent to exile in the British colonies of the Caribbean, where he becomes a pirate.

9.name: A Midsummer Night's Dream
9.description: Theseus, Duke of Athens, is going to marry Hyppolyta, Queen of the Amazons. Demetrius is engaged with Hermia, but Hermia loves Lysander. Helena loves Demetrius. Oberon and Titania, of the ...                See full summary »

10.name: Anna Karenina
10.description: The married Anna Karenina falls in love with Count Vronsky despite her husband's refusal to grant a divorce, and both must contend with the social repercussions.

11.name: The Dawn Rider
11.description: When John Mason's father is killed, John is wounded. Attracted to his nurse Alice, a conflict arises between him and his friend Ben who plans to marry Alice. John later finds the killer of ...                See full summary »

12.name: A Tale of Two Cities
12.description: A pair of lookalikes, one a former French aristocrat and the other an alcoholic English lawyer, fall in love with the same woman amongst the turmoil of the French Revolution.

13.name: The Informer
13.description: In 1922, an Irish rebel informs on his friend, then feels doom closing in.

14.name: Call of the Wild
14.description: During the Klondike Gold Rush, a traveler purchases a dog to lead the way toward the treasure, but reconsiders his journey when he finds a jilted married woman.

15.name: Les Misérables
15.description: In early 19th Century France an ex-convict who failed to report to parole is relentlessly pursued over a 20 year period by an obsessive policeman.

16.name: Sylvia Scarlett
16.description: Escaping to England from a French embezzlement charge, widower Henry Scarlett is accompanied by daughter Sylvia who, to avoid detection, "disguises" herself as a boy, "Sylvester." They are ...                See full summary »

17.name: The Personal History, Adventures, Experience, & Observation of David Copperfield the Younger
17.description: A gentle orphan discovers life and love in an indifferent adult world.

18.name: Werewolf of London
18.description: The juice of a rare Tibetan flower is the only thing that keeps Dr. Glendon from turning into a werewolf during a full moon.

19.name: Dante's Inferno
19.description: Jim Carter moves in on the McWade's carnival concession which shows scenes from Dante's "Inferno". He makes it a going concern, marrying Betty along the way. An inspector calls the ...                See full summary »

20.name: Crime and Punishment
20.description: Man is haunted by a murder he's committed.

21.name: The Last Days of Pompeii
21.description: In the doomed Roman city, a gentle blacksmith becomes a corrupt gladiator, while his son leans toward Christianity.

22.name: Mad Love
22.description: In France, an insane surgeon's obsession with an actress from England leads him to replace her pianist husband's hands that got mangled in an accident with the hands of a late knife murderer which still have the urge to throw knives.

23.name: She
23.description: Leo Vincey, told by his dying uncle of a lost land visited 500 years ago by his ancestor, heads out with family friend Horace Holly to try to discover the land and its secret of immortality...                See full summary »

24.name: Naughty Marietta
24.description: In order to avoid a prearranged marriage, a rebellious French princess sheds her identity and escapes to colonial New Orleans, where she finds an unlikely true love.

25.name: The Lives of a Bengal Lancer
25.description: Three British soldiers on the Northwest Frontier of India struggle against the enemy - and themselves.

26.name: China Seas
26.description: When earthy Dolly Portland is rejected by Captain Gaskell in favor of a socialite, she aids Jamesy McCardle, in league with Malay pirates, in his plot to seize his ship.

27.name: The Raven
27.description: A brilliant surgeon obsessed with Edgar Allan Poe saves the life of a beautiful dancer and goes mad when he can't have her.

28.name: Dangerous
28.description: An alcoholic actress who is considered a dangerous jinx is rehabilitated, but she then shows that she's as dangerous as ever.

29.name: Bonnie Scotland
29.description: Stan and Ollie mistakenly enlist in the army and find themselves posted to the Northwest Frontier in India on a dangerous mission.

30.name: 'G' Men
30.description: It's the early days of the F.B.I. - federal agents working for the Department of Justice. Though they've got limited powers - they don't carry weapons and have to get local police approval ...                See full summary »

31.name: The Little Colonel
31.description: After Southern belle Elizabeth Lloyd runs off to marry Yankee Jack Sherman, her father, a former Confederate colonel during the Civil War, vows to never speak to her again. Several years ...                See full summary »

32.name: Mark of the Vampire
32.description: When a nobleman is murdered, a professor of the occult blames vampires; but not all is what it seems.

33.name: Suicide Squad
33.description: Larry Baker is a young fireman whose daring exploits have led him to receiving a lot of newspaper publicity which goes to his head. His sweetheart, Mary O'Connor, and fire-department ...                See full summary »

34.name: The Littlest Rebel
34.description: Shirley Temple's father, a rebel officer, sneaks back to his rundown plantation to see his family and is arrested. A Yankee takes pity and sets up an escape. Everyone is captured and the ...                See full summary »

35.name: Paradise Canyon
35.description: Sent to find counterfeiters, John Wyatt joins Doc Carter's medicine show. They arrive in the town where Curly Joe runs his counterfeiting operation. Carter was once framed by Curly Joe and ...                See full summary »

36.name: Curly Top
36.description: Wealthy Edward Morgan becomes charmed with a curly-haired orphan and her pretty older sister Mary and arranges to adopt both under the alias of "Mr. Jones." As he spends more time with them, he soon finds himself falling in love with Mary.

37.name: The Phantom Empire
37.description: When the ancient continent of Mu sank beneath the ocean, some of its inhabitant survived in caverns beneath the sea. Cowboy singer Gene Autry stumbles upon the civilization, now buried ...                See full summary »

38.name: Ruggles of Red Gap
38.description: An English valet brought to the American west assimilates into the American way of life.

39.name: Bar 20 Rides Again
39.description: Cattle rustler Nevada dreams of living like an emperor in the West. Hoppy and the Bar 20 boys aim to put an end to his dream.

40.name: Broadway Melody of 1936
40.description: Bob Gordon is staging a new Broadway Show, but he is short of money. He gets an offer of money by the young widow Lillian, if she can dance in his new show. Bert Keeler, a newspaper man, ...                See full summary »

41.name: The Devil Is a Woman
41.description: A young man is warned by a captain about a temptress; nonetheless, he finds himself falling in love with her.

42.name: The Crusades
42.description: King Richard and the Third Crusade (1190-1192) are given the DeMille treatment with more spectacle than history.

43.name: The Desert Trail
43.description: Rodeo star John Scott and his gambler friend Kansas Charlie are wrongly accused of armed robbery. They leave town as fast as they can to go looking for their own suspects in Poker City.

44.name: The Ghost Goes West
44.description: A haunted Scottish castle is dismantled and transported to Florida, bringing the family ghost along with it.

45.name: Hop-a-Long Cassidy
45.description: An evil ranch foreman tries to provoke a range war by playing two cattlemen against each other while helping a gang to rustle the cattle. Each cattleman blames the other for missing cattle....                See full summary »

46.name: Charlie Chan in Egypt
46.description: While investigating the theft of antiquities from an ancient tomb excavation, Charlie discovers that the body of the expedition's leader concealed inside the mummy's wrappings.

47.name: Splendor
47.description: The once-great Lorrimore family faces bankruptcy unless older son Brighton marries wealthy Edith Gilbert. When Brighton instead returns from a trip with his new wife Phyllis, she receives a...                See full summary »

48.name: Gold Diggers of 1935
48.description: Romantic antics abound among the guests at a luxury hotel, including a stage director, an eccentric millionaire, and the daughter of a financial backer.

49.name: Peter Ibbetson
49.description: Architect Peter Ibbetson is hired by the Duke of Towers to design a building for him. Ibbetson discovers that the Duchess of Towers, Mary, is his now-grown childhood sweetheart. Their love ...                See full summary »

50.name: First a Girl
50.description: Elizabeth, a delivery girl, dreams of being a music-hall singer but she is refused at the first casting she takes part in. A bit depressed, she gets to know Victor, a would-be Shakespearean...                See full summary »
